course.title: The Greek Bible in History and Theology: Seminar
course.description: An exploration of social, historical, interpretive, and theological issues associated with the so-called Septuagint and its complex relationship to early Judaism and Christianity. Emphases include origins, eschatology, messianism, halakhah, New Testament backgrounds, and biblical theology.
course.prerequisites: Basic reading knowledge of Greek and Hebrew.
course.notes: Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 1301.
